required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study for Patients With Head and Neck Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Phase 3 Study of Pemetrexed in Combination With Cisplatin Versus Cisplatin Monotherapy in Patients With Recurrent or Metastatic Head and Neck Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare the effects of pemetrexed plus cisplatin versus cisplatin alone in head and neck cancer patients.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of death from any cause up to 36 months
primary_outcome.description: OS duration is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. For each participant who is not known to have died as of the data-inclusion cut-off date, OS duration will be censored at the date of the participant's last contact prior to that cut-off date.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Objective PFS is defined as the time from date of randomization to date of objectively determined progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause, whichever comes first. PD was defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). PD=at least a 20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. For participants who are not known to have died as of the data-inclusion cut-off date, and who do not have progressive disease, PFS will be censored at the date of the last objective progression-free disease assessment prior to the date of any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With a Tumor Response (Response Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to progressive disease or discontinuation of study treatment up to 11 months
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor Response is evaluated as CR (Complete Response) or PR (Partial Response) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST criteria). Possible evaluations include: CR: Disappearance of all target lesions. PR: At least a 30% decrease in the size of target lesions. Response rate (%) = (number of participants with CR+PR/number of participants)*100

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time of response to progressive disease up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: DoR is time from first observation of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) to first observation of PD or death. Response is objective status of CR or PR using RECIST criteria. CR is disappearance of lesions. PR is >30% decrease in size of lesions. Responder is any participant with CR or PR. PD is at least 20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. For participants alive as of data-inclusion cut-off date and who do not have PD, DoR will be censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before date of any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Treatment Worsening in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Head and Neck Cancer (FACT-H&N) Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (</=Day 1 of first dose) and Day 1 of every subsequent cycle to 30-day post-study completion up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: FACT-H&N consists of 39 items with 5-point rating scale from 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much). FACT-H&N Total score ranges from 0 to 148. Higher score represents a better quality of life. Time to worsening was defined as the first date of worsening in the FACT H&N Total score that was considered at least the prospectively defined minimally important difference (MID) as compared with participant's baseline score, or date of death from any cause. The MID for FACT H&N Total score was a decrease of 12 points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Biomarkers and Treatment Effect
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between highly up/downregulated genes and clinical response (Overall Survival (OS) and Progression-Free Survival (PFS)). OS is is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. PFS is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of objectively determined progressive disease or death from any cause, whichever comes first. 0 participants were analyzed; Reason: The relatively low number of samples collected would not have yielded a meaningful genomic analysis and the decision was made to not analyze the data.

arm_group.description: Pemetrexed 500 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2) administered intravenously (IV) plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment, Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

Placebo (approximately 100 mL normal saline) administered intravenously (IV) plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

intervention.description: 500 mg/m^2, IV, every 21 days, six 21 day cycles
75 mg/m^2, administered IV, every 21 days, six 21 day cycles
Approximately 100 mL normal saline administered IV, every 21 days, six 21 day cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- You must have head and neck cancer that has returned and cannot be treated with surgery or other types of treatment. OR You must have head and neck cancer that was just found and has spread to other parts of your body.
- You must have a performance status of 0,1 or 2. This means that you must at least be able to get around, be able to take care of yourself and must be up and about most of the day.
- Your test results must show that your liver, kidneys and blood cells are working normally.
- You must understand and sign the form that gives your agreement to willingly be part of the study.
- You must be at least 18 years of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
- You cannot have previously been given other treatment for cancer that has spread to other parts of your body.
- You cannot have a serious sickness that might keep you from finishing the study (for example a bad infection).
- You cannot have any extra fluid in your chest or bowel area unless your doctor tells you it can be drained before you join the study.
- You cannot have any cancer called nasopharyngeal cancer, paranasal sinus cancer, lip cancer, or salivary gland cancer.
- If you are taking high dose aspirin or other medicines called non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and cannot stop taking them for at least 5 days, you cannot be in the study. Your doctor or a member of the study team can explain which drugs are non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.

group.title: Pemetrexed/Cisplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed 500 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2) administered intravenously (IV) plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

group.title: Placebo/Cisplatin
group.description: Placebo (approximately 100 mL normal saline) administered IV plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

measure.title: Previously Treated for Head and Neck Cancer (HNC)
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: These scales and criteria are used by doctors and researchers to assess how a patient's disease is progressing, assess how the disease affects the daily living abilities of the patient, and determine appropriate treatment and prognosis: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction Restricted in strenuous activity,able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature Ambulatory, but unable to carry out any work activities. Capable of only limited selfcare Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Dead

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: OS duration is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. For each participant who is not known to have died as of the data-inclusion cut-off date, OS duration will be censored at the date of the participant’s last contact prior to that cut-off date.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of death from any cause up to 36 months
outcome.population: Intention to Treat (ITT) Population - defines the treatment group as those to which participants were assigned by random allocation, even if a participant did not take the assigned treatment, did not receive the correct treatment, or otherwise did not follow the protocol.

group.title: Pemetrexed/Cisplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed 500 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2) administered intravenously (IV) plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

group.title: Placebo/Cisplatin
group.description: Placebo (approximately 100 mL normal saline) administered IV plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: OS duration is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. For each participant who is not known to have died as of the data-inclusion cut-off date, OS duration will be censored at the date of the participant’s last contact prior to that cut-off date.
measure.population: Intention to Treat (ITT) Population - defines the treatment group as those to which participants were assigned by random allocation, even if a participant did not take the assigned treatment, did not receive the correct treatment, or otherwise did not follow the protocol.

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Objective PFS is defined as the time from date of randomization to date of objectively determined progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause, whichever comes first. PD was defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). PD=at least a 20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. For participants who are not known to have died as of the data-inclusion cut-off date, and who do not have progressive disease, PFS will be censored at the date of the last objective progression-free disease assessment prior to the date of any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease up to 33 months
outcome.population: Intention to Treat (ITT) Population - defines the treatment group as those to which participants were assigned by random allocation, even if a participant did not take the assigned treatment, did not receive the correct treatment, or otherwise did not follow the protocol.

group.title: Pemetrexed/Cisplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed 500 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2) administered intravenously (IV) plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

group.title: Placebo/Cisplatin
group.description: Placebo (approximately 100 mL normal saline) administered IV plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

measure.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: Objective PFS is defined as the time from date of randomization to date of objectively determined progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause, whichever comes first. PD was defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). PD=at least a 20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. For participants who are not known to have died as of the data-inclusion cut-off date, and who do not have progressive disease, PFS will be censored at the date of the last objective progression-free disease assessment prior to the date of any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.
measure.population: Intention to Treat (ITT) Population - defines the treatment group as those to which participants were assigned by random allocation, even if a participant did not take the assigned treatment, did not receive the correct treatment, or otherwise did not follow the protocol.

outcome.title: Percent of Participants With a Tumor Response (Response Rate)
outcome.description: Tumor Response is evaluated as CR (Complete Response) or PR (Partial Response) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST criteria). Possible evaluations include: CR: Disappearance of all target lesions. PR: At least a 30% decrease in the size of target lesions. Response rate (%) = (number of participants with CR+PR/number of participants)*100
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to progressive disease or discontinuation of study treatment up to 11 months
outcome.population: Intention to Treat (ITT) Population - defines the treatment group as those to which participants were assigned by random allocation, even if a participant did not take the assigned treatment, did not receive the correct treatment, or otherwise did not follow the protocol.

group.title: Pemetrexed/Cisplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed 500 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2) administered intravenously (IV) plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

group.title: Placebo/Cisplatin
group.description: Placebo (approximately 100 mL normal saline) administered IV plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

measure.title: Percent of Participants With a Tumor Response (Response Rate)
measure.description: Tumor Response is evaluated as CR (Complete Response) or PR (Partial Response) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST criteria). Possible evaluations include: CR: Disappearance of all target lesions. PR: At least a 30% decrease in the size of target lesions. Response rate (%) = (number of participants with CR+PR/number of participants)*100
measure.population: Intention to Treat (ITT) Population - defines the treatment group as those to which participants were assigned by random allocation, even if a participant did not take the assigned treatment, did not receive the correct treatment, or otherwise did not follow the protocol.

analysis.method_desc: p-value is based on an unadjusted, normal distribution approximation for differences in rates.

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DoR)
outcome.description: DoR is time from first observation of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) to first observation of PD or death. Response is objective status of CR or PR using RECIST criteria. CR is disappearance of lesions. PR is >30% decrease in size of lesions. Responder is any participant with CR or PR. PD is at least 20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. For participants alive as of data-inclusion cut-off date and who do not have PD, DoR will be censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before date of any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.
outcome.time_frame: time of response to progressive disease up to 24 months
outcome.population: ITT population with a confirmed best response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR).

group.title: Pemetrexed/Cisplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed 500 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2) administered intravenously (IV) plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

group.title: Placebo/Cisplatin
group.description: Placebo (approximately 100 mL normal saline) administered IV plus cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 on Day 1 every 21 days. Pretreatment - Both Treatment Arms: Dexamethasone administered orally (po): 4 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID) taken on the day before, the day of, and day after study treatment. Vitamin B12 administered intramuscularly (im): 1000 micrograms (μg) taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and every 9 weeks until 3 weeks after last treatment dose. Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

measure.title: Duration of Response (DoR)
measure.description: DoR is time from first observation of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) to first observation of PD or death. Response is objective status of CR or PR using RECIST criteria. CR is disappearance of lesions. PR is >30% decrease in size of lesions. Responder is any participant with CR or PR. PD is at least 20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. For participants alive as of data-inclusion cut-off date and who do not have PD, DoR will be censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before date of any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.
measure.population: ITT population with a confirmed best response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR).

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Worsening in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Head and Neck Cancer (FACT-H&N) Total Score
outcome.description: FACT-H&N consists of 39 items with 5-point rating scale from 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much). FACT-H&N Total score ranges from 0 to 148. Higher score represents a better quality of life. Time to worsening was defined as the first date of worsening in the FACT H&N Total score that was considered at least the prospectively defined minimally important difference (MID) as compared with participant’s baseline score, or date of death from any cause. The MID for FACT H&N Total score was a decrease of 12 points.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (</=Day 1 of first dose) and Day 1 of every subsequent cycle to 30-day post-study completion up to 33 months
outcome.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population with at least Baseline data.

Folic Acid administered orally (po): 350 μg to 1000 μg taken 1 to 2 weeks before treatment and continue daily until 3 weeks after last treatment dose.

measure.description: FACT-H&N consists of 39 items with 5-point rating scale from 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much). FACT-H&N Total score ranges from 0 to 148. Higher score represents a better quality of life. Time to worsening was defined as the first date of worsening in the FACT H&N Total score that was considered at least the prospectively defined minimally important difference (MID) as compared with participant’s baseline score, or date of death from any cause. The MID for FACT H&N Total score was a decrease of 12 points.
measure.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population with at least Baseline data.

outcome.title: Correlation Between Biomarkers and Treatment Effect
outcome.description: Correlation between highly up/downregulated genes and clinical response (Overall Survival (OS) and Progression-Free Survival (PFS)). OS is is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. PFS is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of objectively determined progressive disease or death from any cause, whichever comes first. 0 participants were analyzed; Reason: The relatively low number of samples collected would not have yielded a meaningful genomic analysis and the decision was made to not analyze the data.
outcome.population: Zero participants were analyzed because the relatively low number of samples collected would not have yielded a meaningful genomic analysis.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
